name: Cartoon Network Block Party
description:
Cartoon Network Block Party is a party game that keeps the game play fast and fun on the Game Boy Advance. Play as any of 6 characters from your favorite Cartoon Network cartoon properties: Johnny Bravo, Courage the Cowardly Dog, Cow and Chicken and Ed, Edd n Eddy.

Challenge up to 3 friends on 4 colorful themed boards, each styled after Cartoon Network shows: Planet Johnnywood, Katz's Creepy Castle, The Tater Farm and Extreme Cul-De-Sac. Master 14 unique mini-games that challenge all of your skills: Riding Mower Grand Prix, Waterbomb Catch, Fish Frenzy, Backyard Boogie, Strike a Pose, Greased Porkbutt Catch, Fence Sitters, Weremole Waltz and many more. Cash mini-games reward players with money so they can pay for a competitive advantage or access passes to other areas of the board.
developedBy: Monkeystone Games, One Man Band LLC

shot.caption: Title screen
The game's main menu
Selecting a board for a Quick play session.
Starting game with Cow.
The skating mini-game similar to the one in California Games, though much more simple, as you can get perfect score every time you play it.
Greesed Porkbutts minigame. The AI players don't put up much of a fight in this one, making it just boring.
Aim for the fences mini-game. In this one you have to hit characters lazily moving back and forth along the fence.

In this minigame you have to dodge the water balloons falling from the top of the screen for as long as you can. Playing this game with larger characters such as Johnny Bravo or Cow is near impossible
Strike-a-Pose mini-game is a boring Simon-Says clone that never gets any more challenging and is just dull to look at.
In Zombeat the clock the player must find three heads of garlic, while avoiding zombies. Once the garlic is found, the zombies must be chased down and 'cured'.
This is basically a slow, boring and completely non-challenging Frogger clone.
The Fishing Derby is slow, boring and ugly.
This Super Sprint-type racing minigame could in fact be fun, if only the AI wasn't so brain-dead.
Another mini-game with the only challenge not to fall asleep while playing.
Waremole Waltz is a fun little mini-game specific to the last board of the game. If only the collision boxes on the enemies weren't so huge...
Tiny flames pop up all over the place and must be promptly hit with water balloons... I'm afraid kids might get bad ideas from this one.
In this mini-game one must catch diagonally-flying bats. It can be fun, but the bats are generated to unevenly, so occasionally you will just sit there with no bats spawned at all.
A mini-game similar to Waremole Waltz, only made completely un-fun by randomly generated junk that is nearly impossible to avoid because of terrible collision.
If played in Tournament mode the boards will be introduced via simple cut-scenes.
...Just to emphasize how simple those cut-scenes are.
A screenshot from the spooky-castle-type board
